alert.note: Alert for Bland; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:12PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Tazewell, northwestern Bland and southwestern Mercer Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coaldale, or near Matoaka, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bluefield... Matoaka... Bastian... Pocahontas... Bramwell... Ceres... and Clear Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
